storyInfo: The transport truck will soon make its last trip. Warmy works with Alanna to prepare their truck to be returned. However, still attached to the truck, she is hoping to delay its return. Almost as if in answer to her prayers, a strange passenger hijacks the truck and demands to be taken to the Grinning Valley.

attributes.text: I hear leaves blooping and bubbling away inside a scalding hot pot. I love that sound.

There's the static from Dad's radio too, and the oldie hawking on about sharpening your blades, and the sound of the ute's power plant as it drives... I love all that too. But I'm not gonna hear them anymore. Or, well... I won't soon enough.
Here's the fire, burning. Telling me, hey, chin up, just chin up a bit... you know, Dad's hoping you will.
Actually, I think the fire's a little weak. I'll give it a bit of air. Puffff—
Eh? What's that sound I hear...?

attributes.content: Lanns! Can you not dink on your bowl?
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: I told you to stop doing that! What if you get on someone's nerves?
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: I'll dink on anything I please. Can't I be the boss of my own ute? Besides, with how loud the truck stop is, nobody's gonna be pointing fingers at me!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Don't make excuses.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: I'm just bored, mate...
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: You're making an awful lot of food today. What's the occasion anyway? I've been waiting ages, I'm starved!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: I had to make some noise to get a message across to the food: 'Don't get cold now, we need to wait for Potlid to join us for our meal.'
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Excuses again... You don't worry about anything, you're like a kid.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: If you're that bored, come help me out in the kitchen!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Oh, but you're the six-star chef here. You're killing it in there, Potlid!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Would you stop calling me Potlid alrea—
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: —What's this red dish here?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Oh, that's the tomato braised cystybeast!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: It's fresh from the pot. It'll blow you away!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Tomato braised cystybeast? What's with the color? Shouldn't the broth be a little more yellowy—?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Before she can finish her sentence, Alanna has already rammed her spoon into the piping-hot bowl and scooped an entire slab of cystybeast meat into her mouth.
The food burns her tongue, but Alanna gives the Potlid a thumbs-up nonetheless.
...Hm... Mmhmm...
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: It's perfect! That's our truck's six-star chef!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Hehe~
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: But the meat you brought back this time's especially fresh. I didn't have to use a lot of seasoning to make it taste good!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Really? Looks like the market man gave us the freshest on hand, knowing we're leaving. Guess it was worth buying from him for two years.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Don't say things like that, Lanns. I think he's been real good to us from the very beginning, going by what you've told me.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: I'm picturing a kinda short, good-tempered man in a dirty apron. A short, fat, middle-aged man.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Yeah, nah, that's not what he looks like. When he stands in front of his shop holding a cleaver, not a single person dares to swipe even a single carrot from the market.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Haha. When you get older, I'll let you walk around town yourself.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: That reminds me. When was the last time we had tomato braised cysty?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: The last time...?
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: It was probably when we first ate together.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: And you made that meal yourself!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Oh, that does feel like a long time ago. You still remember?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Of course!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: You said 'cooking's just one of the things I'm good at,' but then you made an in-sane-ly sour tomato braised cystybeast.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: *cough*, how was I supposed to know those tomatoes were gonna be that sour? The broth was bright and yellow. It looked so tasty.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: I still remember the look on your face after you gave it a taste.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Wh-What does it matter if it helps fill our tummies? Flavor comes second! And didn't you finish all of yours?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: It's not good to waste food! Besides...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Ah, let's not talk about the past. I don't want the food to get cold because you can't stop complaining.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Potlid lightly touches the bowl, and suddenly the braised meat becomes just as piping hot as when it was fresh out of the pot.
Amid the rising white steam, Alanna's expression grows stern.
Hey!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Didn't we agree not to use Arts for little things like that?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: But this is the fastest way to warm it up...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: I'm just heating the food up. Just a quick use. It's nothing to worry about!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Whatever. It's your health, not mine.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: But as soon as we get to Iron Carrot City, we need to find you a teacher who can teach you real proper casting.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Come on, tuck in. What are you waiting for?
attributes.name: Alanna
Potlid
attributes.content: Let me enjoy the view first.

attributes.name: Potlid
attributes.content: You always look so happy when you eat. It puts a smile on my face just watching you.
attributes.joined: Let me enjoy the view first.You always look so happy when you eat. It puts a smile on my face just watching you.

attributes.content: Potlid takes a cloth and wipes clean the broth that's spilled over the bowl, then wipes her hands.
She takes a few thick books from the shelf and stacks them on her seat, one-by-one, before sitting on top of them.
Potlid places one arm on the table flat while her other hand props her head up, and she looks at Alanna with a smile on her face.
We're going to have to return the truck when we get to Iron Carrot City, and they'll shut the route down forever.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Yeah.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Think you'll miss it?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: ...Not really.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Warmy never gets sad.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Well, alright then.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: In that case, after this route's suspended, do you still wanna stay on my truck?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: After we return it to the company, they'll probably keep it around. Though I doubt it'll go to the stops we took before.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Even so, I won't let it get to me... Yeah, nuh-uh, I won't!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: As long as you're right here by my side, there's nothing to be unhappy about!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Alanna reaches out to pat Potlid on the head. Her ears twitch in response.
Hehehe...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: What's wrong?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Th-That kinda tickles...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Seeing the young Cautus's reaction, Alanna laughs.
Then—
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Then, my wonderful, perpetually-smiley Potlid. Help me run some errands later, will ya?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Huh? But it's been so long since I've gone into town...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: You'll be fine.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: See, I took the safety valve off to make it go faster, and I can't have the company finding that out when they inspect the ute.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: So we need a new safety valve right quick.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: And we'll also need some daily necessities for a long trip. The workers said they'd bring us some, but I said no.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Hm... the guys at the motor pool know you're leaving?
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Yeah, but I still have heaps of things that I need to deal with here. If I were to go, I might not be done by tomorrow morning.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Do they know you're taking me with you?
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Hm, I suppose.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Anyhow, that's why I'm counting on you to take care of that. You're a young lady already anyway.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: And here—
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Alanna passes Potlid a paper scrap with some wobbly writing on it.
Sell those things out the front door. We should be able to get some money out of them.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: As for the rest, follow the shopping list. Here's my purse. Take it with you.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: I still have one last bit of work to handle.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: So this is the last...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Let's divvy up the work and get this done. Divide and conquer.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Okay... let's do it!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: ...Then the metal crab woke up. It got to its feet, snipped twice, and carved the tower crane into pieces.
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: Everyone took a good look, and turns out all that reinforced concrete didn't make a dent in its shell when everything came crumbling down. Of course they dropped their shovels and blowtorches and ran for their lives.
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: Haha, how's that? I heard it's based on a real story, real people, uh, crab and all. This is what we're showing for tonight's open-air movie night, over at the slag heap.
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: Eh, no need to thank me. I've never seen you around, so you have to be new here.
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: Let me go more into the rules of our ball and card games here. Each factory district has different rules. You know that, right?
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: ...I just want a sandbeast.
attributes.name: Reticent Customer

attributes.content: Ahem... Fine.
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: I have a few of them in this basket here. Pick whichever you want. All my sandbeasts are well-trained. They eat and sleep and follow their masters close.
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: You really don't wanna talk about anything else? Like, fine weather today, isn't it? It's not often we get a day without a sandstorm out here. Makes work much easier—
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: W-Watch out! Out of the way. Out of the way—
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: I-I can't stoppppppp—!
attributes.name: Potlid
General Storekeeper
attributes.content: Crikey, who's having such a little kid cart all these things? Don't they know this street goes downslope...?

attributes.name: General Storekeeper
attributes.content: ...Little girl, you with me? You think you got brain damage?
attributes.joined: Crikey, who's having such a little kid cart all these things? Don't they know this street goes downslope...?...Little girl, you with me? You think you got brain damage?

attributes.content: *sobs*...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: I'm okay! I'm not a baby anymore! I'll be fine!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Ah! It took me so much work to pile up the pots and dishes. Now they're all over the ground...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: The little girl prepares to bend down to pick up a big pot. At the same time, a hand reaches out for it.
The two both take a reflexive step back; Potlid nervously tugs her own sleeve.
Um... Miss, I can pick these things up myself. You don't have to help me.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Okay.
attributes.name: Reticent Customer

attributes.content: Also, thanks for stopping my hand truck there!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Yeah, you didn't say you wanted to stop, but there's a recycling facility up ahead. It wouldn't be good if you crashed into it.
attributes.name: Reticent Customer

attributes.content: Huh...? Okay, you have a point!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: I'm sorry, Mister. My things are blocking your shop's entrance. I'll clean it all up right away!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: It's fine, little girl. Take your time.
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Oh, hold on, so this is the 'Tinny Longears' general store.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Mister, I'm here to talk business!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Business? Hahaha... shouldn't someone be watching you?
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: I don't need her to help me with this. She has her own work to do. We're dividing and conquering.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Mhm... Alright. Wait here for a sec.
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: Girl, you picked out a sandbeast yet?
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: Let me have another look.
attributes.name: Reticent Customer

attributes.content: I'll deal with the little girl first, then. C'mon, what are you buying?
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: First things first. I need to sell some things before I buy anything.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Take a look at these pots and pans, as well as this Originium gas cooker. I'm selling them all. I heard that second-hand kitchenware that's kept well and clean sells for a lot of money.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: *cough*, *cough*... A pot so scorched, even its handle's black, a fork with broken teeth, and scrap sheet metal... You're trying to sell this?
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: With the money I make from selling these and the change in my purse, I know I'll have enough for a safety valve, an electrode holder, spray paint...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: *sigh*, how about this? Bring everything you want to buy to the counter. I'll give you a discount and take your wares based on the total price. Whatever's left over, I won't take.
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: Nuh-uh, I have to sell all these things.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: I can treat you to a cold carrot.
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: Okay!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: It's a deal, then. Let's see. This gas cooker is more than enough. Take the rest of that garbage back with you, okay?
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: On second thought... nuh-uh.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: You're a weird one, little girl... Why are you insisting on selling all those things? If you didn't look like such a nice little bun, I'd be thinking you committed some kind of crime and came here to get rid of evidence.
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: And let's be real. I don't know you from Bruce. How am I supposed to just offload the garbage you hauled here? What if you turn out to be an Infected?
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: I knew it! An afternoon wasn't going to be enough to sell all of it! Nuh-uh, I told her, and she didn't believe me.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Alright, I'll have to report back, then think of something!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Hold on, little one. Who sent you?
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: Huh? Lanns. Alanna of the Barrenlands.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Alright, alright. I don't know you, but I do know her. Look at her dumping her work on a little girl like you. Not that I'm surprised.
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: Here, a footstool. That way you can get a better view while I tally the numbers up. Tell her I'll take her things for now, and whenever she gets a day off, she owes me a meal.
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: Huh? Why the change of heart...?
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Hm, I guess it's fair. I'm not a kid anymore. If I'm asked to do something, I get it done.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: What's the matter? You're weren't happy when I wouldn't 'talk business,' and you're also unhappy that I'm taking these off your hands?
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: Huh? Yeah, nah. I've been happy the whole time.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Hmm... the safety valve model that Lanns told me to get's not on the shelf.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Let's see...
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: Didn't this model go obsolete ages ago? Ever since the union set the regs, the guidebook's been full of tips to never buy that junk again.
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: Nuh-uh, I have to go look for it elsewhere. I'll find it! Mister, look after the hand truck for me!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: *sigh*... I really need to talk to Alanna about this.
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: What about you, Miss? Have you picked one yet? Or do you have something else in mind?
attributes.name: General Storekeeper

attributes.content: Agh, what do I even do with you? Gimme the spanner. I'll do it. I know my ute better than anybody else.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Hey, you hired me for this, Alanna. You want to save yourself some money, come out and say it.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: I'm not always tight on money like your broke arse. I'm no alcoholic, and I don't drive my truck so bad that it breaks down every other day.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Besides, if I do less work than you, how am I supposed to boast to Potlid about my skills?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Hahaha, that little runt...?
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: This thing we're taking apart right now. That's where she sleeps, right?
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: Uh-huh.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Hahahaha, really?! Alright, I'll give it to you. I lost this time.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: We all thought you were just talking big.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: Given your temper, shouldn't you have made her somebody else's problem a long time ago?
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: —Uh, my bad. Stop glaring.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: My temper? Hmph, who do you even think I am? I took her in because all of you bet against me having the patience to take care of a kid, and I wasn't going to take that slander lying down.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Look down on me again, and the next time I'm back, I'll kick a ball into your faces.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Eh, it's mainly that we haven't seen her the last two years. We only have your word to go on.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: You got your treads chewed by a big beckbeast, you swapped the control valve at the last minute under Catastrophe clouds to speed up your transport, you caught a passenger that got blasted into the sky by a geyser... Everything you say is like it's all happened.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: That all actually happened, I'm telling you.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Fine, it happened. Now why did you keep her locked away in the truck the whole time, never letting her out to spend time with the rest of us?
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: —Surely she didn't want to stay shut up in there?
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: ...If that's really the case, what are you planning to do tomorrow when the truck's out of commission?
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: ...I'll figure something out once I get to Carrot's. The company has to give me a new route, right?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: You'll figure something out... Hold on, you're going to Iron Carrot City to wait for a new route instead of staying here?
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: You're never coming back?
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: Hm, this is the only one I could get... It's not quite what Lanns told me to find, but the shop said we should at least be able to plug it in. It'll be fine.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: It's getting dark. If I don't hurry and get back, we won't finish everything we have to do.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Lanns... should be back too by now?
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Uh, little girl, hello? You're walking kinda leisurely, not like you're trying to catch a ride...
attributes.name: Jittery Passenger

attributes.content: Huh? Do I look leisurely? Hehe...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: If I might have a little of your time, would you happen to know when the last transport to Iron Carrot City leaves?
attributes.name: Jittery Passenger

attributes.content: Half past nine at night.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: I know that route better than anybody.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Oh, okay. Appreciate it, kid.
attributes.name: Jittery Passenger

attributes.content: Half past nine... I still have some time.
attributes.name: Jittery Passenger

attributes.content: *sigh*, I'm really worried about Lanns for some reason. What's going on...?
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: There is an old, abandoned workshop belonging to the vehicle located at the city transport gateway. Its lights, familiar as ever, can be seen through its windows.
Potlid wipes the dust off the window and peeks inside—
The passage leading to the exit bears the 'workplace fatigue' from the workers' frantic movement, all the loading and unloading they perform every day.
They say the passage is old and smoothed out, just like the bottom of the tin lunch box that the old factory director has used and washed for two decades.
As the workers cheer on, a metal ball, or more precisely, an amalgamation of a variety of scrap metals compressed together and polished into a ball, is dropped onto the smooth surface.
The ball rolls forward.
Good shot, mate!
attributes.name: Worker 'Brake'

attributes.content: Beautiful, and you knocked them all down in one go... Good one, Alanna!
attributes.name: Worker 'Motor'

attributes.content: Let's see. Eighteen, nineteen... You're ahead by twenty. How are we supposed to catch up?
attributes.name: Worker 'Brake'

attributes.content: Charlie, you sproglet. Let's call it quits while our score doesn't look too terrible. Don't embarrass the factory!
attributes.name: Worker 'Brake'

attributes.content: Alright, alright. Just shut up and watch. Let me show you wankers what a perfect shot looks like.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: Instead of worrying about me, maybe start racking your brains to figure out how we'll decorate tonight's send-off party for Alanna...
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: First, we'll make it a welcome party. We'll welcome Alanna as a proper member of the Rustdreg Town motor pool family.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: Really now? If you don't knock all the pins down in this one go, you aren't getting another shot at it.
attributes.name: Worker 'Motor'

attributes.content: Put a sock in it.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: He bends down to put the fallen pins upright, and rubs his hands against his trouser pockets, his sweat leaving a clearly visible mark on the fabric.
He picks up the ball, places his toes just slightly before the foul line, and stares straight ahead—
Hold on.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Charlie, that's enough.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: I'm in the lead for now, and you still have a chance to overtake me. We could put our argument on hold—Considering the score, it should be an acceptable outcome for both of us.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Let's call it a draw. What do you say?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Alanna, forget this place. There's not a single person in all the matches ever played in the RMIA who ever tried to pull a trick like this.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: If I'm remembering right, we agreed that if I win, you stay. If you win, we won't keep you, and you can go wherever.
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: And now you're asking for a draw...? What do you want us to do? Cut you in half and have one half drive your truck, while the other half stays here?
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: Or are you going to spend half of your time on your new life and the other half with your old friends?
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: I'll pass. I'm not like those new factory district reps.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: They announce their newest expansion plans at their morning conferences, supervise mine work in the afternoons, and go to some boring social engagements in the evenings.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: I've got more than enough on my plate, and I can't be in two places at once. I only have enough sanity in me to hold the gear lever, at most leaning one ear closer to the passengers to eavesdrop on their funny stories.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: So, here's my suggestion—
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: I'll head to Carrot's to get everything dealt with. The next time I'm back, I'll talk to all of you about joining the motor pool.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: So you're saying you're never coming back!
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: Why? Because of our bet? Because of that little kid?
attributes.name: Charlie the Sproglet

attributes.content: Lanns?
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: ...Potlid?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Wh-Wh-Why are you bowling here? Didn't you... Didn't you say you had lots to take care of?
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Uh, we haven't settled our bet, so of course I have to take care of this—
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: (Sighs)
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: (Whispers) Lanns... you lazy cystybeast.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Potlid raises her hand up high and shoves Alanna's shoulder as hard as she can.
Her sleeve slides down to reveal a black, irregularly-shaped crystal cluster. Not even the bracelet that Alanna gave her is able to hide its luster.
Hm? Why are your friends all looking at me?
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: —Ugh, they're just curious. Come, we're going back to the ute.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Woah...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: What do you think? I'm willing to bet no one could tell that just four hours ago, there used to be an illegal kitchen here, right?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: That's what you get with the best vehicle makeover hands in the entire district. It's not every day I get to put my skills to work.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Yep, I really can't tell at all...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: But Lanns... You didn't tell me you were taking it apart...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: ...Even so, it's amazing!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: You told me the work we had left was a huge pain, and you might not finish if you had to do it all alone. Isn't that why you asked me to buy all those things?
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: But not only are you all done, you're bowling with the men here. You're even having a lolly water and reading magazines!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Uh, haha, but of course.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Anyhow, we only have three minor problems left now.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: First off, we need to use spraypaint to cover up the smoke damaged wall here. Let me show you how it works first. After that, you have fun with the other two cans.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: I think I might've started a few too many fires...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Next, we have the power plant pipeline's safety valve.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Oh, I couldn't find the kind you wanted. Does that mean...?
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Does that mean we won't be able to hand in the truck tomorrow?
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Don't worry. I knew you wouldn't be able to find a model that old.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Ehh...?
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: You see, we're getting our truck inspected and upgraded because even though all the other parts are fairly new, the power plant is too old.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: No one cared about it before, but the unions in Big Pillar have been clamoring for standardization.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Hah, 'standardization.' Sounds like a pretty cool word, right? You can think of it as setting up rules.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: The old power plant's problems don't bother me, but the union says they're switching over to the top-of-the-line thingies in the ads for our own good, and I think they have a point.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Anyway, it's because ours is against the rules that we're going to get a new one from a transport company in Carrot's tomorrow. We'll be fine, even if this valve isn't a perfect fit.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: We just have one last run. As long as it gets our ute to its final destination, it's more than enough.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: And if we end up having to use the backup pipeline, then... I'll need you to help me out.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Just like before, I'll ask you to go down to the power plant to take a look at things, and you'll need to report anything that seems off right away.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Mm... Okay!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Finally...
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: This is the 'Decommissioning Report' we need to hand over to the station when we leave. Once we're gone, we aren't coming back.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Alanna stops for a bit and glances at Potlid.

Hah, all these silly formalities, right? And they barely gave me any heads up. I asked Thick Palm Parker to teach me how to fill out the form, and it took two whole hours. I didn't have time to take it to the station today.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: You did pretty good today, so I'll turn in this report tomorrow morning on my own. You can stay in the toolroom and sleep in!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Hmm...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: If you're sad, it's okay to let it out...
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: ...If we get a route change, you probably won't get a lot of chances to see your mates here, right?
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: That's why I'll hand in the report tomorrow!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: That way, you can spend a bit more time with your mates, and you won't be so sad over not seeing them anymore!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: My kitchen's gone now, but when we get to our new home, once our house is built, I'll make the sweet meat soup that always put a smile on your face.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Haha, sounds good.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Ugh! You slapped my back too hard!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: You're growing up, aren't you? You'll get used to it.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Okay, now catch.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Tonight, I'll let you have lolly waters with me and go to bed an hour later than before.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: *yawn*—So tired.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: But I won't get lost! I'm not a little kid. I can read a map!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Yep, take a turn here, go upstairs right ahead...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Huh...? The man from yesterday is still there. Did he miss his ride?
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Not only is he sitting in the same place, he's in the same pose, and looks just as depressed. Wow, incredible...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Oh, it's you, little girl... G-Good morning... Perfect timing.
attributes.name: Jittery Passenger

attributes.content: Uh, when's the earliest truck to Iron Carrot City today?
attributes.name: Jittery Passenger
Potlid
attributes.content: I'm actually that truck's—

attributes.name: Potlid
attributes.content: No, I mean... I'm taking that truck, too!
attributes.joined: I'm actually that truck's—No, I mean... I'm taking that truck, too!

attributes.content: Looks like I'll make it...
attributes.name: Jittery Passenger

attributes.content: I can take you there. That way, you won't miss it!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: N-N-No thanks!
attributes.name: Jittery Passenger

attributes.content: Sorry, I... I really appreciate it, but... uh, I want to sit here a little longer.
attributes.name: Jittery Passenger

attributes.content: Are you... waiting for someone?
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Me? No, I... Uh, what makes you think that?
attributes.name: Jittery Passenger

attributes.content: Come, Warmy. No more waiting. Let's go back into the hut tonight.
attributes.name: Familiar Kind Man

attributes.content: These things happen.
attributes.name: Familiar Kind Man

attributes.content: Because...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: It's a very normal thing to wait for someone.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Okay, I'll be on my way. Bye bye! I hope you'll get to see the person you're waiting for!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: No, um, I'm scared to death... I don't want to see...
attributes.name: Jittery Passenger

attributes.content: ...*sigh*, Cautus kids sure run quick... I should, uh, thank her nonetheless.
attributes.name: Jittery Passenger

attributes.content: Next. Bring your documents into the office.
attributes.name: Office PA

attributes.content: (Stands on tiptoes) How far away is the office? I can't see it at all from the line...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: What should I do? It's almost time to leave. I don't think I'll get it handed in time.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: So many people here this early. Maybe luck's not on my side. Even a big girl can't help it when she's unlucky.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: *Sigh*, yeah, there are too many people here. Nothing wrong with the union trying to make the event seem more above-board, but they didn't have to handle both beauty pageant registrations and government forms in the exact same place, did they?
attributes.name: No-Nonsense Woman

attributes.content: This is almost exactly how everybody used to line up in front of Grandma's room to complain!
attributes.name: No-Nonsense Woman

attributes.content: Good thing I'm taking care of this. If it'd been the Doctor or Amiya here, it would've been a huge headache, what with how much work they have on their hands.
attributes.name: No-Nonsense Woman

attributes.content: *sigh*, Amiya, Amiya... She's just a teenager. Why exactly does she have so much on her shoulders...?
attributes.name: No-Nonsense Woman

attributes.content: Right, little girl, you said you were in a rush? Small and waifish as you are, you wouldn't be here for the beauty pageant, right?
attributes.name: No-Nonsense Woman

attributes.content: Huh? N-No, I'm here to hand in our 'Decommissioning Report.' Here, it's this one!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: If we don't hand it in today, then it won't get decommissioned, right...?
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Oh, now that's easy. Just let me take care of it.
attributes.name: No-Nonsense Woman

attributes.content: Huh—?
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: But it's our truck that's getting decommissioned... Do you know Lanns?
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Yeah, nah.
attributes.name: No-Nonsense Woman

attributes.content: But you couldn't be the driver, could you?
attributes.name: No-Nonsense Woman

attributes.content: Um, no...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Yep, yep. That's what I am talking about. The report just needs to be handed in. Doesn't matter who does the handing.
attributes.name: No-Nonsense Woman

attributes.content: I need to line up here anyway. Taking your report to the office desk there is nothing. Just leave it to me, and get back to your ride!
attributes.name: No-Nonsense Woman

attributes.content: Oh... why so glum? Is there still something worrying you?
attributes.name: No-Nonsense Woman

attributes.content: Huh? Do I look...? No, I can't be like this.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Um... Here, the report.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Thanks, Miss. You're too kind!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: (This girl's condition...)
attributes.name: No-Nonsense Woman

attributes.content: Here, kid. This is for you.
attributes.name: No-Nonsense Woman

attributes.content: Um... it's a card?
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: A business card. Remember to give it to your family. Might come in handy one day.
attributes.name: No-Nonsense Woman

attributes.content: Hurry up! The passengers will be here any minute!
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: *pant*, *pant*... Coming!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: You're gonna have to hide in the toolroom this trip.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: I'll be fine. Remember, I stayed in there for a long time in the beginning!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Also, you can still use the little terminal here to check the monitoring screens. You can see every person on the truck... Guess I didn't have to say, huh?
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: Yeah.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Alright, I'm off to the driver's cabin.
attributes.name: Alanna

attributes.content: I finished so much in such a short amount of time.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Even though I ran into lots of trouble, and even though Lanns said there probably wasn't enough time... we still managed to get the ute into shape to hand back, and we took care of all the paperwork.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Oh, the man from the station finally made it in. Thank goodness... Right, I even helped someone with the schedule.
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: The transport vehicle's entrance is now closed. The vehicle will soon be powered on. Please take your seats or find a suitable area to affix your folding chair, bench, or mat...
attributes.name: All-Transport-Trucks Broadcast

attributes.content: ...I did such a great job, I should be happy, even proud of myself!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: But, but...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Actually...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: I don't care what happens, I wish our truck didn't have to be retired—!
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: I... I still haven't got to see...
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: This vehicle's being hijacked. We're heading to the Grinning Valley.
attributes.name: All-Transport-Trucks Broadcast

attributes.content: ...Huh?
attributes.name: Potlid

attributes.content: Potlid looks at the display panel where the driver cabin's monitoring screen is shown.
The unfamiliar voice heard through the broadcast belongs to the strange woman she met yesterday. She's holding Alanna's broadcast mic with one hand.
Her other hand is steadily holding her crossbow, with its bolt pressed against the side of Alanna's neck.
She stares at Potlid with a cold glare through the monitoring camera's lens, perhaps noticing the subtle movement of its shift in angle.
Anyone not heading to the Grinning Valley can get off now, driver included.
attributes.name: All-Transport-Trucks Broadcast

attributes.content: Huh...? It's a real truckjacking?
attributes.name: Potlid
